articles.author: Julie Burchstead Master Gardner
articles.description: Question: A couple weeks ago I saw a bumblebee out and about. Don’t they usually hibernate? Are there things I can plant in my yard to support them when nothing much is blooming?
articles.title: Ask A Master Gardener: Supporting bees when nothing blooms

articles.author: Kris Wiley For The News-Review
articles.description: Between watching the Winter Olympics and the medical drama “The Pitt,” my adrenaline has been pumping this month. For readers seeking a thrill, I recommend these recently published books.
articles.title: Thrilling reads for exciting times

articles.author: GLORIA COLEMAN The News-Review
articles.description: Cow Creek Band of Umpqua Tribe of Indians and U.S. Department of Agriculture Forest Service signed a new shared stewardship agreement, designed to expand collaborative forest and rangeland restoration in the Umpqua and Rogue River-Siskiyou national forests.
articles.title: Cow Creek Umpqua, Forest Service sign new stewardship agreement

articles.author: ANDREW GRIFFIN The News-Review
articles.description: Since 1937, over 2 million acres of Oregon's timberland has remained under the jurisdiction of the U.S. Department of the Interior (DOI) as O&C timberlands. Now, plans dictating how those lands are managed may be going through major changes.
articles.title: Notice of intent issued for revisions to BLM's O&C Resource Management Plan

articles.author: Scott Carroll The News-Review
articles.description: Terry Lea Deane, or “Grandma Terry” to her family, doted on her great-grandkids, was a jokester with a contagious laugh, and didn’t go anywhere without her lapdog Sadie.
articles.title: Respected and beloved: the life of Terry Lea Deane

articles.author: GLORIA COLEMAN The News-Review
articles.description: Douglas County Sheriff's Office announced around 3 p.m. Thursday that it located Hannah Olsen in the Azalea area, alive and unharmed, and has notified her family. No further updates are expected.
articles.title: DCSO requests help to locate missing Canyonville resident

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: An autism awareness walk is planned March 1 at Fir Grove Park in Roseburg following the Fremont Middle School injury investigation. Organizers say the event aims to raise awareness and invite community participation after a grand jury declined to indict two aides.
articles.title: Autism Awareness Walk Planned in Roseburg Following Fremont Middle School Investigation

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: The Umpqua Valley Public Defender will debut its Equal Justice Initiative at a Roseburg art show featuring Jerome Sloan. The $5 entry event includes a silent auction and community dialogue. Proceeds will support rural public defense recruitment and training efforts across Oregon.
articles.title: Umpqua Valley Public Defender To Launch Equal Justice Initiative With Community Art Show In Roseburg

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: PacifiCorp agreed to pay $575 million to settle federal claims tied to six wildfires in Oregon and California. The funds will reimburse suppression costs and support land restoration. The settlement resolves allegations only, and the company continues to deny liability.
articles.title: PacifiCorp Agrees to $575 Million Settlement With U.S. Over Six Western Wildfires Including Archie Creek

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: A Douglas County grand jury returned a no true bill for two Fremont Middle School instructional aides, finding insufficient evidence to pursue criminal charges in a case involving injuries to two students. An investigation into a separate teacher at the school remains ongoing.
articles.title: Grand Jury Declines Charges Against Two Fremont Middle School Instructional Aides

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Roseburg crews are removing downtown parking meters and installing new signs for free, time-limited parking. The changes expand one-, two-, and three-hour zones and include updated permit fees for city lots and the parking garage. On-street permits will be available once signs are in place.
articles.title: Roseburg Begins Downtown Parking Meter Removal, New Time-Limit Signs Going Up

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Roseburg Schools will host its final early literacy night March 9 at Rose Elementary for families with children ages 2–4. The free event includes storytelling, hands-on activities and take-home materials for early readers. Registration is required and space is limited.
articles.title: Roseburg Schools To Host Final Early Literacy Night For Young Families March 9

articles.title: Roseburg man transforms life through drug court and helps others recover

articles.title: Roseburg mom pulls kids from Fremont Middle School after son suffers broken arm in class
